channel.title: The Hon. Rob Portman
channel.description: The Hon. Rob Portman U.S. Senator, Ohio (Remarks as Prepared for Delivery)

item.title: Good evening America, and hello to the fired-up delegation from the Buckeye State right in front of me.
item.author: The Hon. Rob Portman

item.title: My name is Rob Portman and they say I was on Governor Romney's short list of vice presidential candidates.
item.author: The Hon. Rob Portman

item.title: Apparently, it wasn't short enough.
item.author: The Hon. Rob Portman

item.title: But it's been a great convention and I am delighted to be here tonight to talk about the fundamental differences between Mitt Romney and Barack Obama when it comes to understanding our economy.
item.author: The Hon. Rob Portman

item.title: Let's begin by talking about something the Democrats love to demonize - Mitt Romney's success in the private sector. He built a company from the ground up, created lots of jobs, and yes, he made money.
item.author: The Hon. Rob Portman

item.title: He made it the old fashioned way . . . He earned it.
item.author: The Hon. Rob Portman

item.title: Then you have Barack Obama, who has never started a business--never even worked in business. And he claims those who have should give credit to the government or someone else for their success.
item.author: The Hon. Rob Portman

item.title: So, you have one candidate who understands that success comes from working hard, competing and taking risks.
item.author: The Hon. Rob Portman

item.title: And you have another candidate who believes success comes from government.
item.author: The Hon. Rob Portman

item.title: Which one do you think knows how to turn this economy around?
item.author: The Hon. Rob Portman

item.title: Which one would you choose to invest your life's savings? Should it be any different for safeguarding our nation's economy?
item.author: The Hon. Rob Portman

item.title: Or let's say you don't have any savings. Let's say you're worried about how to pay September's rent or mortgage.
item.author: The Hon. Rob Portman

item.title: Let's say you are one of the millions of Americans out of work or the millions more who have given up looking.
item.author: The Hon. Rob Portman

item.title: You've gotta be running out of patience ­ and hope. You have to be tired, looking for a new start.
item.author: The Hon. Rob Portman

item.title: Well, you don't have to be patient any longer. Through your vote this fall you can change the leadership of this country and the opportunities for you and your family.
item.author: The Hon. Rob Portman

item.title: America, it has been nearly four years of over eight percent unemployment ­ and double digit unemployment for young people, Hispanics and African-Americans.
item.author: The Hon. Rob Portman

item.title: Four years. FDR and Truman won an entire world war in four years.
item.author: The Hon. Rob Portman

item.title: America is tired of waiting.
item.author: The Hon. Rob Portman

item.title: In business, if you don't move rapidly, you are out of business. You are finished.
item.author: The Hon. Rob Portman

item.title: We want a president who operates at business speed not government speed.
item.author: The Hon. Rob Portman

item.title: President Obama says he deserves reelection because his economic policies have worked.
item.author: The Hon. Rob Portman

item.title: NOT in this universe they haven't.
item.author: The Hon. Rob Portman

item.title: In fact, the experts tell us that if we don't change our policies we are going back into recession next year.
item.author: The Hon. Rob Portman

item.title: Tens of millions of Americans are not out of the last recession!
item.author: The Hon. Rob Portman

item.title: Governor Romney had a plan to build his business. He now has a detailed plan to restore our economy and strengthen the middle class.
item.author: The Hon. Rob Portman

item.title: I ask you: Where is the president's economic plan?
item.author: The Hon. Rob Portman

item.title: Blaming others does not qualify as a plan. Now the president did submit a budget. It was so bad that not a single Republican or a single Democrat in the entire United States Congress would vote for it.
item.author: The Hon. Rob Portman

item.title: He got zero votes. That is a failure of leadership. President Obama has been right about at least one prediction he's made about the economy. He said, "If I don't have this done in three years, then there's going to be a one-term proposition."
item.author: The Hon. Rob Portman

item.title: I think you are right about that, Mr. President.
item.author: The Hon. Rob Portman

item.title: It hasn't worked, because you cannot spend your way, regulate your way, tax your way or blame your way out of the economic mess we are in.
item.author: The Hon. Rob Portman

item.title: You have to liberate the productive power of the American people through policies that encourage innovation, risk taking, investment and jobs.
item.author: The Hon. Rob Portman

item.title: And you have to compete and win in the global economy. Governor Romney understands this.
item.author: The Hon. Rob Portman

item.title: In contrast, President Obama is the first president in 75 years--Democrat or Republican--who hasn't even sought the ability to negotiate export agreements and open markets overseas. Now why is this important?
item.author: The Hon. Rob Portman

item.title: Because 95 percent of the world's consumers live outside our borders. And to create jobs, our workers and our farmers need to sell more of what we make to those people.
item.author: The Hon. Rob Portman

item.title: While this administration has been dragging its feet, other countries have been busy negotiating hundreds of new trade agreements to benefit their workers and their farmers, taking away our opportunities.
item.author: The Hon. Rob Portman

item.title: President Obama has been so driven to advance his big government ideology that he has abandoned the daily economic work that a government must do to open markets, restore business confidence and create the climate for job growth.
item.author: The Hon. Rob Portman

item.title: This is the work President Romney would begin on day one.
item.author: The Hon. Rob Portman

item.title: Take trade with China. China manipulates its currency giving it an unfair trade advantage. So why doesn't the president do something about it?
item.author: The Hon. Rob Portman

item.title: I'll tell you one reason ­ President Obama could not run up his record trillion dollar deficits if the Chinese did not buy our bonds to finance them.
item.author: The Hon. Rob Portman

item.title: We are as beholden to China for bonds as we are to the Middle East for oil.
item.author: The Hon. Rob Portman

item.title: This will end under Mitt Romney.
item.author: The Hon. Rob Portman

item.title: We need to knock down these trade barriers abroad, but we also need to knock down the self- imposed barriers to success right here at home.
item.author: The Hon. Rob Portman

item.title: We need to reform our outdated and complicated tax code. We need to fix our burdensome regulatory system and we need an energy policy that encourages development of our resources right here, in the ground, in America. America has a choice between Mitt Romney, who seeks to grow the economy, and Barack Obama who seeks to redistribute it.
item.author: The Hon. Rob Portman

item.title: Which one do you think will liberate America's entrepreneurial spirit?
item.author: The Hon. Rob Portman

item.title: At the other party's convention, you will hear the chant, "Four more years. Four more years."
item.author: The Hon. Rob Portman

item.title: Folks ­ we can't afford four more years. How about no more years?
item.author: The Hon. Rob Portman

item.title: Governor Romney chose a terrific partner in Paul Ryan of Wisconsin ­ Paul is a close friend with a great family and a reformer's heart.
item.author: The Hon. Rob Portman

item.title: Vice President Biden has told people out of work to just, "hang in there." So much for hope and change.
item.author: The Hon. Rob Portman

item.title: Paul Ryan is not asking America to continue to hang in there. He is proposing new policies that will give poor and middle class families opportunities and hope for the future.
item.author: The Hon. Rob Portman

item.title: Mitt Romney made his mark turning around businesses and solving problems.
item.author: The Hon. Rob Portman

item.title: Paul Ryan made his mark as a respected reformer focused on results.
item.author: The Hon. Rob Portman

item.title: Together they will do what President Obama has not done: They will lead in breaking through the partisan gridlock in Washington, D.C.
item.author: The Hon. Rob Portman

item.title: America, give them the chance to restore America's economy and restore the American dream.
item.author: The Hon. Rob Portman

item.title: I have seen that dream up close. When I was a kid, my dad left his job as a salesman and started his own business selling forklift trucks. My Mom was the bookkeeper. He had to borrow money from her uncle because the bank wouldn't give him a loan. He lost money for the first few years, but he never lost his dream.
item.author: The Hon. Rob Portman

item.title: And by the time he retired and my brother took over, the business had 200 employees ­ supporting 200 families in Southwest Ohio.
item.author: The Hon. Rob Portman

item.title: This is the classic American story ­ not of government telling us what to do ­ but of free men and free women willing to work hard and take a risk to build something of value for themselves, their families and their community.
item.author: The Hon. Rob Portman

item.title: About a year into the Obama Administration ­ I asked my dad whether he would do it again. He said, "Rob ­ with all the uncertainty out there today ­ I don't know if I would take the risk."
item.author: The Hon. Rob Portman

item.title: In that one sentence, he summed up what I've heard from hundreds of small business owners across Ohio and around this great country. They're afraid to make the investment and jobs are the casualty. Ladies and gentlemen, we need new leadership and new policies to bring back the dream and renew America's promise.
item.author: The Hon. Rob Portman

item.title: No more excuses, no more blaming others, no more waiting.
item.author: The Hon. Rob Portman

item.title: We need Romney /Ryan and we need them now! And with your help, it will happen.
item.author: The Hon. Rob Portman

item.title: Thank you and God bless our great country.
item.author: The Hon. Rob Portman
